data.text: Any of numerous small, rounded, usually colorful beetles of the family Coccinellidae, often reddish with black spots and feeding primarily on other insects, including pests such as scale insects and aphids.
data.attributionText: from The American HeritageÂ® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: A ladybird: the more common name in the United States and in some parts of England.

data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.

data.text: any beetle of the Coccinellidae family of <xref>beetles</xref>, typically having a round shape and a colorful shell.
data.attributionText: from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.

data.text: small round bright-colored and spotted beetle that usually feeds on aphids and other insect pests
